text: President Maithripala Sirisena worshiped the historical Nagadeepa Raja Maha Viharaya off Jaffna Peninsula yesterday (April 17).He looked into the well-being of the Chief Incumbent of the temple Ven. Navandagala Padumakiththithissa Thero, and offered ata pirikara to him.The President who engaged in religious activities at the temple watched the museum in the temple premises.Chief Incumbent of the Ruwanveli Maha Seya Ven. Pallegama Hemarathana Thero also joined this occasion.The President also visited Sri Naga Pusan Amman Kovil and engaged in religious activities.President Maithripala Sirisena worshiped the historical Nagadeepa Raja Maha Viharaya off Jaffna Peninsula yesterday (April 17).He looked into the well-being of the Chief Incumbent of the temple Ven. Navandagala Padumakiththithissa Thero, and offered ata pirikara to him.The President who engaged in religious activities at the temple watched the museum in the temple premises.Chief Incumbent of the Ruwanveli Maha Seya Ven. Pallegama Hemarathana Thero also joined this occasion.The President also visited Sri Naga Pusan Amman Kovil and engaged in religious activities.
title: President visits Nagadeepa Raja Maha Viharaya
